questions.question_text:
You plan to upload a large file (3 TiB) to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Object Storage. You would like to minimize the impact of network failures while uploading, and therefore you decide to use the multipart upload capability.
Which TWO statements are true about performing a multipart upload using the Multipart Upload API? (Choose two.)

choices.A: While a multipart upload is still active, you can keep adding parts as long as the total number is less than 10,000.
choices.C: You do not have to commit the upload after you have uploaded all the object parts.
choices.D: You do not need to split the object into parts. Object Storage splits the object into parts and uploads all of the parts automatically.
choices.B: When you split the object into individual parts, each part can be as large as 50 GiB.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
confirmed via documentation D

AB

Search on this page.
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Object/Tasks/usingmultipartuploads.htm

* While a multipart upload is still active, you can keep adding parts as long as the total number is less than 10,000.
* With multipart upload, you split the object you want to upload into individual parts. Individual parts can be as large as 50 GiB

questions.question_text: Which statement is TRUE about delegating an existing domain to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) DNS service?

discussion.content:
A is the correct answer.
https://www.oracle.com/uk/cloud/networking/dns/faq/
How do I delegate my domain to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure DNS?
Domains can be delegated to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure DNS from the Domain Registrarâ€™s self-service portal.

Correct answer is: E

E. Domains can be delegated to OCI DNS via FastConnect partners.

Explanation:
OCI DNS is a highly scalable, global anycast domain name system network. To make your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure hosted zone accessible through the internet, you must delegate your domain with your domain's registrar. You can use the noted name servers provided by OCI DNS to change your domain's DNS delegation. The registrar's documentation will provide instructions on how to delegate your domain to OCI DNS. FastConnect partners are one of the options to establish a dedicated network connection to OCI, which can include DNS services like OCI DNS [7].

The other options listed (A, B, C, and D) are not correct based on the information provided from the internet sources and the context of DNS management with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

choices.C: Domains can be delegated to OCI DNS from the OCI Marketplace.
choices.A: Domains can be delegated to OCI DNS from the Domain Registrar's self-service portal.
choices.E: Domains can be delegated to OCI DNS via FastConnect partners.
choices.B: All domains can be retrieved to OCI DNS via DYN.
choices.D: Domains can be self-delegated to OCI DNS from its own service portal.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Metric-based autoscaling relies on performance metrics that are collected by the Monitoring service, such as CPU utilization 
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Compute/Tasks/autoscalinginstancepools.htm

choices.D: Install OCI SDK on all compute instances and create a script that triggers the autoscaling event if there is high memory usage.
choices.B: Install the monitoring agent on all compute instances, which triggers the autoscaling group.
choices.C: Configure the autoscaling policy to monitor CPU usage and scale up the number of instances when it meets the threshold.
choices.A: Configure the autoscaling policy to monitor memory usage and scale up the number of instances when it meets the threshold.

questions.question_text:
You are responsible for deploying an application on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). The application is memory intensive and performs poorly if enough memory is not available. You have created an instance pool of Linux compute instances in OCI to host the application and defined Autoscaling Configuration for the instance pool.
What should you do to ensure that the instance pool autoscales to prevent poor application performance?
Which are the TWO tools you would use for Logical migration? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: its not the right answer, is right is A, B.

choices.A: No action required. By default, the replica is available as a block volume.

discussion.content:
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Block/Concepts/volumereplication.htm
o create a new volume from a volume replica, you need to activate the replica.

Selected Answer: C
Activate the replica

Selected Answer: C
Activate the replica

Selected Answer: C
Activate the replica

questions.question_text:
You have a block volume created in the US West (Phoenix) region. You enabled Cross Region Replication for the volume and selected US West (San Jose) as the destination region. Now, you would like to create a new volume from the volume replica in the US West (San Jose) region.
What should you do?
